poem:
### In Lincoln Heights

The river remembers,  
an old scar dividing dreams;  
hills cradle whispers  
of freedom beneath clipped lawns.  
Souls steady under threat,  
weathering storms of hate—  
a quiet defiance  
in each dawn's return.  
Where history's shadows lengthen,  
golden voices rise.  
Safety—an echo,  
resilient as the Ohio,  
coursing, unbroken.
